reviewText:
This picture turned out to be better than I expected. Acting is fine and the plot was puzzling enough to be interesting. I also appreciated the several scenes on board trains.... ( love trains!).
I bought it with trepidation because of its date (1955). I adore film noir from the '40s and this date is a little late for those....however, it did contain some wonderful dark night scenes and didn't have that '50's TV-look to it that some of the pictures in the '50s began to have.
Overall, a  nice surprise!

Well worth seeing for the legion of Ulmer admirer's. Barbara Payton is more than a curiosity. A beautiful and talented actress whose off screen life was worse than the hard and brutalized women she played on screen. Payton did make a film with James Cagney called Kiss Tomorrow Goodbye. This isn't it.

Murder Is My Beat no longer has the Cagney name attached on its Amazon page.

Langton and Shayne were experienced noir/crime veterans who are solid in this film. Payton contributes her strange sexy/distracted appeal, and her acting is not bad in this. I believe this was her final film before become totally unemployable due to lifestyle issues. "Murder is My Beat" demonstrates once again that you don't need a budget to make a watchable noir.
Barbara's last film. Well worth seeing. Thanks!
The movie arrived in great condition n plays fine.
Good story  the picture it's not as good

I expected  the Movie Murder in the Blue Room.  this is from the same era but I really wanted Murder in the Blue Room
it has special meaning to me and my sister
